page.title: 02The Village Store,Rivenhall
page.content: The village shop is a small family business offering a personal service to the local community.Deliveries are made on request to any who are elderly or unwell.The stock is suited to the needs of local people for example; basic foods, newspapers, magazines, cigarettes and household goods.A video library also operates from the village shop.The busiest time of day is between 3.30 p.m. and 4.30 p.m. because children are leaving school at this time. Paper boys deliver newspapers and magazines from the shop each morning. Accounting and details of stock are dealt with manually. Nothing in the shop is computerised. The shop has never been broken into but occasionally items have been taken by shoplifters.
